text: Mporokoso is a constituency of the National Assembly of Zambia.Mporokoso National Assembly of Zambia It covers the towns of Mporokoso and Mukunsa in Northern Province. ==List of MPs== {| class=wikitable !Election year !MP !Party |- |1964||Mulenga Chapoloko||United National Independence Party |- |colspan=3 align=center|Seat abolished (split into Mporokoso North and Mporokoso South) |- |1973||Wila Mung'omba||United National Independence Party |- |1978||Unia Mwila||United National Independence Party |- |1983||Unia Mwila||United National Independence Party |- |1988||Kasonde Mwamba||United National Independence Party |- |1991||Ackim Nkole||Movement for Multi-Party Democracy |- |1996||Ackim Nkole||Movement for Multi-Party Democracy |- |2001||Chiti Sampa||Movement for Multi-Party Democracy |- |2006||Maynard Misapa||Movement for Multi-Party Democracy |- |2011 (by-election)||Maynard Misapa||Patriotic Front |- |2011||Nevelyn Willombe||Patriotic Front |- |2016||Brian Mundubile||Patriotic Front |} ==References== Category:Constituencies of the National Assembly of Zambia Category:1964 establishments in Zambia Category:Constituencies established in 1964
title: Mporokoso (constituency)
